resources.string:
So, how it all started? 
According to the legend an Ethiopian goatherd named Kaldi observed his goats prancing and frolicking about. 
When Kaldi investigated he saw that the goats were merrily eating the red berries and shiny leaves of an unfamiliar tree. 
Kaldi decided to try some, and when he did he joined the dancing goats and became “the happiest herder in happy Arabia!

Hmm.. it\'s look like he has a good coffee... \nThe name \'Coffee\' came from the word \'QAHWA\' which means wine, \nThat is why for years coffee was considered to the islamic wine, and was even used as an aid to concentration

Cappuccino- Religious Beginnings: \nThe word \'cappuccino\' in Italian means \'little hood\'. It’s because of the hoods worn by a particular order of Franciscan monks which was founded in the early 16th century that they were given this moniker – Capuchin monks, or “Cappuccini” in Italian.

What do raspberries have to do here? \nWell, this aren\'t raspberries, this are the coffee fruits which are called coffee beans or cherries A coffee bean is a seed of the coffee plant, and is the source for coffee. It is the pit inside the red or purple fruit often referred to as a cherry. \nThe brown coffee beans we know are Roasted coffee beans
And Messi kicks the boll, and \'ohhhh goal!!!\' \nResearch shows that consuming caffeine before a workout can help you work out harder and longer.
Five Facts You Didn\'t Know About Coffee!!
